operations.ConfigureLogs: Changes the Channel's properities to configure log subscription
operations.DescribeHarvestJob: Gets details about an existing HarvestJob.
operations.DescribeOriginEndpoint: Gets details about an existing OriginEndpoint.
operations.ListHarvestJobs: Returns a collection of HarvestJob records.
operations.ListOriginEndpoints: Returns a collection of OriginEndpoint records.
operations.RotateChannelCredentials: Changes the Channel's first IngestEndpoint's username and password. WARNING - This API is deprecated. Please use RotateIngestEndpointCredentials instead
operations.RotateIngestEndpointCredentials: Rotate the IngestEndpoint's username and password, as specified by the IngestEndpoint's id.

refs.HlsManifest$AdMarkers:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.
"SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35
messages in the input source.
"DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events 
in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value 
that is greater than 0.
refs.HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters$AdMa:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.
"SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35
messages in the input source.
"DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events 
in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value 
that is greater than 0.
refs.HlsPackage$AdMarkers:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.
"SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35
messages in the input source.
"DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events 
in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value 
that is greater than 0.

AdTriggers.base:
A list of SCTE-35 message types that are treated as ad markers in the output.  If empty, no
ad markers are output.  Specify multiple items to create ad markers for all of the included
message types.

AdsOnDeliveryRestrictions.base:
This setting allows the delivery restriction flags on SCTE-35 segmentation descriptors to
determine whether a message signals an ad.  Choosing "NONE" means no SCTE-35 messages become
ads.  Choosing "RESTRICTED" means SCTE-35 messages of the types specified in AdTriggers that
contain delivery restrictions will be treated as ads.  Choosing "UNRESTRICTED" means SCTE-35
messages of the types specified in AdTriggers that do not contain delivery restrictions will
be treated as ads.  Choosing "BOTH" means all SCTE-35 messages of the types specified in
AdTriggers will be treated as ads.  Note that Splice Insert messages do not have these flags
and are always treated as ads if specified in AdTriggers.

ChannelCreateParameters.base: Configuration parameters for a new Channel.

ChannelUpdateParameters.base: Configuration parameters for updating an existing Channel.

CmafEncryption.base: A Common Media Application Format (CMAF) encryption configuration.

CmafPackage.base: A Common Media Application Format (CMAF) packaging configuration.

CmafPackageCreateOrUpdateParameters.base: A Common Media Application Format (CMAF) packaging configuration.

ConfigureLogsParameters.base: The configuration parameters for ingress and egress access logging.

DashEncryption.base: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) encryption configuration.

DashPackage.base: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) packaging configuration.

EncryptionContractConfiguration.base:
Use encryptionContractConfiguration to configure one or more content encryption keys for your endpoints that use SPEKE 2.0. 
The encryption contract defines which content keys are used to encrypt the audio and video tracks in your stream. 
To configure the encryption contract, specify which audio and video encryption presets to use.
Note the following considerations when using encryptionContractConfiguration:
encryptionContractConfiguration can be used for DASH endpoints that use SPEKE 2.0. SPEKE 2.0 relies on the CPIX 2.3 specification.
You must disable key rotation for this endpoint by setting keyRotationIntervalSeconds to 0.

HarvestJobCreateParameters.base: Configuration parameters for a new HarvestJob

HlsEncryption.base: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) encryption configuration.

HlsIngest.base: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) ingest resource configuration.

HlsManifest.base: A HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters.base: A HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

HlsPackage.base: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) packaging configuration.

IngestEndpoint.base: An endpoint for ingesting source content for a Channel.

refs.DashPackage$ManifestLayout: Determines the position of some tags in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to FULL, elements like SegmentTemplate and ContentProtection are included in each Representation.  When set to COMPACT, duplicate elements are combined and presented at the AdaptationSet level.

MssEncryption.base: A Microsoft Smooth Streaming (MSS) encryption configuration.

MssPackage.base: A Microsoft Smooth Streaming (MSS) packaging configuration.

OriginEndpointCreateParameters.base: Configuration parameters for a new OriginEndpoint.

OriginEndpointUpdateParameters.base: Configuration parameters for updating an existing OriginEndpoint.

refs.OriginEndpoint$Origination:
Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint
may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be
requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$Originati:
Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint
may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be
requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination
refs.OriginEndpointUpdateParameters$Originati:
Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint
may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be
requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination

refs.HlsManifest$PlaylistType:
The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type.
When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE
entry will be included in the media playlist.
refs.HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters$Play:
The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type.
When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE
entry will be included in the media playlist.
refs.HlsPackage$PlaylistType:
The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type.
When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE
entry will be included in the media playlist.

refs.EncryptionContractConfiguration$PresetSp: A collection of audio encryption presets.
A collection of video encryption presets.

refs.DashPackage$Profile: The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type.  When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled.

S3Destination.base: Configuration parameters for where in an S3 bucket to place the harvested content

refs.DashPackage$SegmentTemplateFormat: Determines the type of SegmentTemplate included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to NUMBER_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.  When set to TIME_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Time$ media URLs. When set to NUMBER_WITH_DURATION, only a duration is included in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.

SpekeKeyProvider.base: A configuration for accessing an external Secure Packager and Encoder Key Exchange (SPEKE) service that will provide encryption keys.

refs.HarvestJob$Status:
The current status of the HarvestJob. Consider setting up a CloudWatch Event to listen for
HarvestJobs as they succeed or fail. In the event of failure, the CloudWatch Event will
include an explanation of why the HarvestJob failed.

refs.StreamSelection$StreamOrder: A directive that determines the order of streams in the output.

Tags.base: A collection of tags associated with a resource

refs.DashPackage$UtcTiming: Determines the type of UTCTiming included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD)

refs.HlsEncryption$RepeatExtXKey: When enabled, the EXT-X-KEY tag will be repeated in output manifests.
refs.HlsManifest$IncludeIframeOnlyStream: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.
refs.HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters$Incl: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.
refs.HlsPackage$IncludeIframeOnlyStream: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.
refs.HlsPackage$UseAudioRenditionGroup: When enabled, audio streams will be placed in rendition groups in the output.

refs.CmafEncryption$KeyRotationIntervalSecond: Time (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.
refs.CmafPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds:
Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.
refs.CmafPackageCreateOrUpdateParameters$Segm:
Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.
refs.DashEncryption$KeyRotationIntervalSecond: Time (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.
refs.DashPackage$ManifestWindowSeconds: Time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.
refs.DashPackage$MinBufferTimeSeconds: Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.
refs.DashPackage$MinUpdatePeriodSeconds: Minimum duration (in seconds) between potential changes to the Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD).
refs.DashPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds:
Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.
refs.DashPackage$SuggestedPresentationDelaySe: Duration (in seconds) to delay live content before presentation.
refs.HlsEncryption$KeyRotationIntervalSeconds: Interval (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.
refs.HlsManifest$PlaylistWindowSeconds: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.
refs.HlsManifest$ProgramDateTimeIntervalSecon:
The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag
inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the
ingest time of the content.
If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then
no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective
of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,
it will be passed through to HLS output.
refs.HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters$Play: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.
refs.HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters$Prog:
The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag
inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the
ingest time of the content.
If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then
no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective
of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,
it will be passed through to HLS output.
refs.HlsPackage$PlaylistWindowSeconds: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.
refs.HlsPackage$ProgramDateTimeIntervalSecond:
The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag
inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the
ingest time of the content.
If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then
no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective
of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,
it will be passed through to HLS output.
refs.HlsPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds:
Duration (in seconds) of each fragment. Actual fragments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source fragment duration.
refs.MssPackage$ManifestWindowSeconds: The time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.
refs.MssPackage$SegmentDurationSeconds: The duration (in seconds) of each segment.
refs.OriginEndpoint$StartoverWindowSeconds:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpoint$TimeDelaySeconds:
Amount of delay (seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$Startover:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$TimeDelay:
Amount of delay (seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointUpdateParameters$Startover:
Maximum duration (in seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointUpdateParameters$TimeDelay:
Amount of delay (in seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.StreamSelection$MaxVideoBitsPerSecond: The maximum video bitrate (bps) to include in output.
refs.StreamSelection$MinVideoBitsPerSecond: The minimum video bitrate (bps) to include in output.

refs.CmafPackage$HlsManifests: A list of HLS manifest configurations

refs.CmafPackageCreateOrUpdateParameters$HlsM: A list of HLS manifest configurations

refs.HlsIngest$IngestEndpoints: A list of endpoints to which the source stream should be sent.

refs.DashPackage$PeriodTriggers:
A list of triggers that controls when the outgoing Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH)
Media Presentation Description (MPD) will be partitioned into multiple periods. If empty, the content will not
be partitioned into more than one period. If the list contains "ADS", new periods will be created where
the Channel source contains SCTE-35 ad markers.

refs.OriginEndpoint$Whitelist: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$Whitelist: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointUpdateParameters$Whitelist: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.
refs.SpekeKeyProvider$SystemIds: The system IDs to include in key requests.

refs.Authorization$CdnIdentifierSecret: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the secret in Secrets Manager that your Content Distribution Network (CDN) uses for authorization to access your endpoint.
refs.Authorization$SecretsRoleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that allows MediaPackage to communicate with AWS Secrets Manager.
refs.Channel$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the Channel.
refs.Channel$Description: A short text description of the Channel.
refs.ChannelCreateParameters$Description: A short text description of the Channel.
refs.ChannelCreateParameters$Id:
The ID of the Channel. The ID must be unique within the region and it
cannot be changed after a Channel is created.
refs.ChannelList$NextToken: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.
refs.ChannelUpdateParameters$Description: A short text description of the Channel.
refs.CmafEncryption$ConstantInitializationVec: An optional 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks. If you don't specify a value, then MediaPackage creates the constant initialization vector (IV).
refs.CmafPackage$SegmentPrefix: An optional custom string that is prepended to the name of each segment. If not specified, it defaults to the ChannelId.
refs.CmafPackageCreateOrUpdateParameters$Segm: An optional custom string that is prepended to the name of each segment. If not specified, it defaults to the ChannelId.
refs.DashPackage$UtcTimingUri: Specifies the value attribute of the UTCTiming field when utcTiming is set to HTTP-ISO or HTTP-HEAD
refs.HarvestJob$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the HarvestJob.
refs.HarvestJob$ChannelId: The ID of the Channel that the HarvestJob will harvest from.
refs.HarvestJob$CreatedAt: The time the HarvestJob was submitted
refs.HarvestJob$EndTime: The end of the time-window which will be harvested.
refs.HarvestJob$Id:
The ID of the HarvestJob. The ID must be unique within the region
and it cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted.
refs.HarvestJob$OriginEndpointId:
The ID of the OriginEndpoint that the HarvestJob will harvest from.
This cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted.
refs.HarvestJob$StartTime: The start of the time-window which will be harvested.
refs.HarvestJobCreateParameters$EndTime: The end of the time-window which will be harvested
refs.HarvestJobCreateParameters$Id:
The ID of the HarvestJob. The ID must be unique within the region
and it cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted
refs.HarvestJobCreateParameters$OriginEndpoin:
The ID of the OriginEndpoint that the HarvestJob will harvest from.
This cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted.
refs.HarvestJobCreateParameters$StartTime: The start of the time-window which will be harvested
refs.HarvestJobList$NextToken: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.
refs.HlsEncryption$ConstantInitializationVect:
A constant initialization vector for encryption (optional).
When not specified the initialization vector will be periodically rotated.
refs.HlsManifest$Id: The ID of the manifest. The ID must be unique within the OriginEndpoint and it cannot be changed after it is created.
refs.HlsManifest$ManifestName: An optional short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL. If not specified, defaults to the manifestName for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.HlsManifest$Url: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.
refs.HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters$Id: The ID of the manifest. The ID must be unique within the OriginEndpoint and it cannot be changed after it is created.
refs.HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters$Mani: An optional short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL. If not specified, defaults to the manifestName for the OriginEndpoint.
refs.IngestEndpoint$Id: The system generated unique identifier for the IngestEndpoint
refs.IngestEndpoint$Password: The system generated password for ingest authentication.
refs.IngestEndpoint$Url: The ingest URL to which the source stream should be sent.
refs.IngestEndpoint$Username: The system generated username for ingest authentication.
refs.OriginEndpoint$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpoint$ChannelId: The ID of the Channel the OriginEndpoint is associated with.
refs.OriginEndpoint$Description: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpoint$ManifestName: A short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL.
refs.OriginEndpoint$Url: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$ChannelId:
The ID of the Channel that the OriginEndpoint will be associated with.
This cannot be changed after the OriginEndpoint is created.
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$Descripti: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$Id:
The ID of the OriginEndpoint.  The ID must be unique within the region
and it cannot be changed after the OriginEndpoint is created.
refs.OriginEndpointCreateParameters$ManifestN: A short string that will be used as the filename of the OriginEndpoint URL (defaults to "index").
refs.OriginEndpointList$NextToken: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.
refs.OriginEndpointUpdateParameters$Descripti: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.
refs.OriginEndpointUpdateParameters$ManifestN: A short string that will be appended to the end of the Endpoint URL.
refs.S3Destination$BucketName: The name of an S3 bucket within which harvested content will be exported
refs.S3Destination$ManifestKey: The key in the specified S3 bucket where the harvested top-level manifest will be placed.
refs.S3Destination$RoleArn: The IAM role used to write to the specified S3 bucket
refs.SpekeKeyProvider$CertificateArn:
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Certificate Manager certificate
that MediaPackage will use for enforcing secure end-to-end data
transfer with the key provider service.
refs.SpekeKeyProvider$ResourceId: The resource ID to include in key requests.
refs.SpekeKeyProvider$RoleArn:
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that AWS Elemental
MediaPackage will assume when accessing the key provider service.
refs.SpekeKeyProvider$Url: The URL of the external key provider service.
